text: The 2001–02 LEN Cup Winners' Cup is the ongoing 28th edition of LEN's second- tier competition for men's water polo clubs. ==Qualifying rounds== ===Qualification round II=== *23–25 November Group winners and runners-up teams of each group advance to quarter finals. {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- !Key to colours in group tables |- style="background:#cfc;" |Group winners and runners-up advance to quarter finals |} ===Group A=== Jadran Herceg Novi has the right to organize the tournament. ===Group B=== Cannstatt has the right to organize the tournament. ===Group C=== Barcelona has the right to organize the tournament. ===Group D=== Dauphins Mouscron has the right to organize the tournament. == Knockout stage == ===Quarter-finals=== The first legs were played on 19 and 20 January, and the second legs were played on 2 and 3 February 2002. ==Semi-finals== The first legs were played on 23 and 24 February, and the second legs were played on 9 and 10 March 2002. ==Finals== The first legs was played on 24 March, and the second legs was played on 14 April 2002. {| style="text-align: center; margin-top: 2em; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto" |- |Zoltán Kósz, Máté Hesz, Norbert Madaras, Zoltán Mátyás, János Plézer, Ádám Steinmetz, Bulcsú Székely, Dániel Varga, Tamás Varga, Zsolt Varga, Attila Vári, Ferenc Vindisch, Zsolt Németh |- |Head Coach |- |József Somossy |} ==See also== *2001–02 LEN Champions League *2001–02 LEN Cup Category:LEN Cup Winners' Cup seasons Cup Winners' Cup Category:2001 in water polo Category:2002 in water polo
title: 2001–02 LEN Cup Winners' Cup
